body.p: “The johnswort and the larger pinweed are conspicuous above the snow. Some fine straw-colored grasses “,” as delicate as the down on a young man’s cheek “,” still rise above this crusted snow “,” and even a recess is melted around them “,” so gently has it been deposited.”
PE 11, pg. 159 / 7 September 1856-1 April 1857/ NNPM MA 1302:28 / T vol. # XXII / PDF # XV / JIX
